result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan W Norton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  To be paid on a regular monthly basis through his probation agent.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Defendant to write a paper, with his agent, on the effects his violence has on his family.

Successfully complete domestic violence programming.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

DV court.  Doing excellent.  Petition to discharge.  He shared with the group.  Did a great job.  Discharged from DV court.
DV court.  Doing very good.  Finished B.G's project.  Went great.  Time to petition for discharge from DV Court.
DV court.  Doing very well.  Presents for B.G. this week.  1 more week after that.  Work still stressful.
Court states she's heard he's doing very well in class and working hard at Ashley.  Keep it up.
DV Court - feels he's doing pretty well in this program.  It's helping him a lot.  Court states he's doing well.
DV court.  Doing very well.
DV court.  Working full time.  Doing good.  Complying.
DV court.  Things are going great.  Work going good.  Class with B.G going good.
DV court.  Doing well.  Got a permanent job.  Had an incident after work.  Need to change how he handles that.  May be a sanction in the future.
DV court.  No firearm possession.  Had a 3 day PO hold.  Must follow rules of probation.  Doing good job with CS.  Has a job at Ashley now.
DV Court.  Gerald Fox presiding.  Defendant FTA.  Warrant to issue

(Hearing recorded)  He starts job with Ashley tomorrow.  Need to work hard and keep that job.  Discussed how he is to work and maintain his programming at the same time.  Let employer and DOC know ahead of time if there is an issue.  Per B.G. - in week 3 and turned in ok/good assignments.  Need to move to next level, have more work to do.  Good report for someone in week 3.  M.J.R. states he's doing very well with community service - good work ethic.
DV court.  Doing community service.  Doing good work.  Has had 1 class with B.G.  Has an interview at the casino tomorrow.
DV Court.  First appearance today.  Expectations explained to defendant.  Need to set up CS or employment.  Talk to CS coordinator after court.  Keep probation agent up to date on job searches.
DNA Proof of Submission form

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State. Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Betthauser.  Victim notification complied with.  No response from victim.  Defendant plead no contest to count 2 as charged.  Count 1 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties of the charge he plead to.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights. Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of count 2.  Joint recommendation for probation 1 year.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  DV programming.  Obtain and maintain employment.  Defendant did not elect to exercise his right to allouction.  Court ordered sentence withheld, 1 year probation.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Successfully complete domestic violence programming.  Obtain and maintain employment. $100, plus costs. Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.  Write a paper on what effects his violence has on his family.  Work on it with probation agent.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-09-2015 10:30 am
Defendant's

Pre-trial conference at 10-07-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 10-26-2015 03:00 pm.

Defendant appeared with attorney Jon Sherman who appeared specially for Charles Betthauser.  Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defense waives reading of the complaint and defendant stands mute.  Court entered not guilty pleas and set for pretrial 10-7 at 10:00 and status conference on 10-26 at 3:00.  Defendant updated his address to PO Box 432, Black River Falls, WI.  Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance at 09-14-2015 09:30 am

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.   Defendant appeared in person without counsel. Court recited charges and possible penalties.  Rights explained.  Defendant will hire an attorney on his own.  AIA set for 9/14/2015 at 9:30 am.
